action.action-desc: Mr. Morelle (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Bowman, and Mr. Keating) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to change certain Federal Pell Grant requirements for certain students with disabilities, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Pell Grant Flexibility Act.

section.header: Amendments to the Higher Education Act of 1965

subsection.text: Section 401(b)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1070a(b)(2)), as amended by section 703 of division FF of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (Public Law 116–260), is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking In any case and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in subparagraph (B), in any case

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: In the case of a student with a disability (as defined in section 3 of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 12102)) for whom a reduced course load has been determined appropriate by the institution of higher education, the student's enrollment in the reduced course load or 5 credits (or the equivalent), whichever is greater, shall be deemed to be enrollment on a full-time basis for purposes of calculating the amount of the Federal Pell Grant to which the student is entitled.
A determination under clause (i) shall not be used in the calculation of Federal Pell Grant semester eligibility under subsection (d)(5).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall take effect as if included in section 703 of division FF of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2021 (Public Law 116–260) and subject to the effective date of section 701(b) of such FAFSA Simplification Act, as amended by section 102(a) of the FAFSA Simplification Act Technical Corrections Act (division R of Public Law 117–103) (including the authorization provided under section 102(c)(1)(A) of such Act).
